questions.text: What is the primary characteristic of Microservices Architecture?
answers: Building applications as a suite of small, independent services
Using micro-sized databases for each service
Writing minimal code for each function
questions.correctAnswer: Building applications as a suite of small, independent services
questions.explanation: Microservices architecture structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled, independently deployable services that communicate through APIs.

questions.text: The Singleton pattern ensures a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to it.
questions.explanation: The Singleton pattern restricts instantiation of a class to one single instance and provides global access to that instance.
